title: BU athletics receives $1 million donation
text:
BU athletics receives $1 million donation 
By Travis Eldridge October 14, 2015 Updated Oct 14, 2015 at 6:59 PM EDT 
Vestal, NY (WBNG Binghamton) The Binghamton University Events Center basketball court has a new name, and the facilities are getting an upgrade thanks to the largest donation in athletic department history. 
Wednesday was a big day for the BU athletics community, as the department received a million dollar donation from local physician Dr. Bai Lee. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
The gift will be used to upgrade the student-athlete's academic center, the strength and conditioning facilities and sports medicine department. 
Dr. Lee did not attend BU, but he is a member of the BU Foundation Board of Directors and has worked in the community for more than 40 years. 
For him, it was important to give back to the community, and the school couldn't be any more grateful. 
"I came from Korea in 1965 with 50 dollars in my pocket, and I have done great in this community," said Dr. Lee. "I think it's time for me to give back something to make the community better." 
"You can't stay stagnant in this business," said BU athletic director Patrick Elliott. "You've got to continue to grow and a gift like this allows us to do this, to grow, to provide quality resources for our student athletes over many years." 
As part of the deal, BU has named the court at the Events Center after Dr. Lee. 
The official ceremony for Dr. Bai Lee court will take place prior to the men's basketball game against Army on Nov. 15. To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required.
